result.execSummary:
The defendant Bret M. Harstvedt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Give/Sell Drugs, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(6).
  • Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 16CF55, 16CF1160, 16CM1379 and 17CF569 called: 8:24am
State appears by ADA K.Puig.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Jack Bliss.

PH waivers in 16CF1160 and 17CF569>>
Court questions deft as to waivers.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  Reading Waived.

State moves to:
16CF1160 - Ct. 2 (DC/DA/REpeater)>>D&RI
17CF569 - Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE
State also moves for COURT to enter judgment on Ct. 1 in 16CF55 - COURT grants, enters judgment and finds defendant guilty. 

PLEA:
16CF1160 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>> NO CONTEST
17CF569 - Ct. 1 (Poss w/Intent/THC/Repeater)>> NO CONTEST
17CF569 - Ct. 3 (OWI 3rd/Repeater)>> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: 
16CF55 - Ct. 2>>9 months MCJ w/credit for 157 days of time already served w/huber or work/work search if defendant qualifies under jail classification system.
16CF55 - Ct. 3>>90 days MCJ w/credit for 90 days of time already served.
>>Both to run concurrent to each other
>>Any unpaid CC are converted to civil judgment (State to file order)

16CF55 - Ct. 1>> Sentence W/held; 6 years Probation, concurrent to all other sentences;  Credit for 5 days in the event of any revocation on this count.
CONDITIONS on this count>>Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; AODA and any follow up recommended; FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; Absolute sobriety; DNA surcharge (sample already given); CC.

16CM1379>>9 months MCJ w/huber for work/work search if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, w/credit for 157 days of time already served
>>Concurrent to any other sentences
>>Any unpaid CC are converted to civil judgment (State to file order)

16CF1160>>Sentence W/held; 1 year Probation, concurrent to all other sentences; Credit for 1 day in the event of any revocation on this count.
CONDITIONS on this count>>SAFE program assessment and any follow up recommended; No Contact with victim S.E. unless as approved by PO; 30 days MCJ I&S and 30 hours CS I&S, with defendant having to participate in the Probation Review Hearings; Any other assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; AODA and any follow up; Absolute sobriety; FTE/FT schooling of combination thereof; DNA surcharge (sample has been taken); CC.
>>>PROBATION REVIEW HEARING SET for this case DECEMBER 15, 2017 at 1:15pm<<<

17CF569 - Ct. 1>>Sentence W/held; 3 years Probation, concurrent to all other sentences; Credit for 1 day in the event of any revocation on this count.
CONDITIONS on this count>> Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; AODA and any follow up recommended; FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; Absolute sobriety; DNA surcharge (sample already given); CC.
17CF569 - Ct. 3>>90 days MCJ, w/huber for work/work search if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, concurrent to all other sentences; $2010 inclusive; 26 month DL Rev w/credit; Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 26 months.

Absolute sobriety. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202- day report within 1 busines day. No contact with minors unless supervised by an adult 25 years or older. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.
